programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the price of a rare mandolin, a 1950s woodworking machine and the business card of a famous outlaw.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered puppets from Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show and a yearbook containing a letter bearing the signature of one-time US president Ronald Reagan.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The crew upgrades an electric car from the 1960s, and Rick is invited to throw the first pitch at a baseball game.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick needs to find spare parts for an alarm clock that gives the sleeper electric shocks, and also tries to turn a petrol pump into a sports locker.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Heavy snowfall leaves trucks backed up in high-risk avalanche zones, and with helicopters dropping bombs to shift the snow build-up, Jamie's team fights to get the traffic moving.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: After Jarrett books a load of monkeys, he and Joe learn the true meaning of the expression 'never work with children or animals'. Meanwhile, Marc takes on a mysterious assignment for a Las Vegas magician.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Chris and Robbie convert their truck to run on vegetable oil, then make a risky attempt to make a deadline on the other side of the country.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Detectives investigate the mysterious death of a Chicago woman, whose body was found dumped on a Wisconsin highway in 1995.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: A ticket dispenser has a run-in with a person who is double parked while trying to rescue a stranded hawk, and a tow driver faces a tough time on the job.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Two officers are on the hunt for a clamped vehicle that has gone missing, and an employee deals with an angry man at the impound lot.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites satirist Charlie Brooker, presenter Scarlett Moffatt and actress Pearl Mackie to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include crocodiles, mosquitoes and having one's hair cut.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Alex Brooker, journalist Jeremy Paxman and actress Sally Phillips to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include positive thinking, tourist attractions and former prime minister David Cameron.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Katy Brand, Ed Gamble, Suzannah Lipscomb and Amol Rajan join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share the name Paul, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Ed Byrne, Angela Barnes, Geoff Norcott
programme.desc: Ed Byrne plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by Angela Barnes and Geoff Norcott.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: The return of the hospital comedy, starring Ed Easton. Simon resorts to desperate measures when Lucy tells him she's engaged to Dr McKenzie, while a new wheeler-dealer porter Anthony threatens Frankie's 'business' empire.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: When surgeon extraordinaire Mr Pradeep is put under Simon's wing for the day, disaster ensues just as a cosplaying Orc fanatic is admitted into the hospital.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ageing confectionery company owner is found dead in his London hotel suite, and while Nikki tries to convince the sceptical DS Gold he was murdered, several businessmen begin to circle as it turns out the dead man was losing a desperate fight to prevent the sale of his company to investors. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves, with guest appearances by Tim Pigott-Smith, Sharon Small and Priyanga Burford.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Evie's affair with the treasury minister hits the papers, while the shop is hit badly by the opening of Maison Gilles in London. Jack is attracted to the star of his latest film.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are faced with the prospect of either selling up or accepting money from Lord Montford and Jack Maddox - an option neither is keen to contemplate.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Magical Christmas Movie Songs
programme.desc: They say there's something magical about Christmas...and we say, it's probably these Christmas songs from such great movies.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Takin' It Old Skool
programme.desc: We're takin' you back to the old skool with some of the best tracks from the last few decades.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: The Fresh List
programme.desc: Keep up to date with some of the hottest new videos dropping right now, from some of your favourite artists and introducing some brand new artists.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The rounding up of escaped pythons in Florida, the making of Panama hats, and how drivers are kept safe in the world's longest tunnel.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini hopes a fishing rod and canoe will add to the value of his 1939 Ford Standard Woodie Wagon.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells four cars at auction in Kissimmee, Florida, but fears they will become lost in a crowd of 2,000 lots.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic complication of some of the most outrageous and dangerous misadventures on wheels. From faulty designs to stunts gone wrong, the crazy real-life footage is endless.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Terrifying Tornado, Free-Fall Fireball, Molten Metal
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures, including a devastating natural disaster.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Bodies and motorcycles hurtle through the air after a high-speed crash, and tanks holding 15,000 gallons of crude oil explode after being struck by lightning.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A stunt driver is crushed by his all-terrain vehicle after a backflip goes wrong in Mexico, and a fire turns a 32-storey Madrid high-rise into a ruin.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Goodson All Terrain faces another financial problem when one of its buyers cancels all future orders of hardwood.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and his team restore the 1965 VW Bug of a fellow mechanic, whose bad health has halted his project.
